events.message: The insured notified us of a collision involving their vehicle and a tree, resulting in significant front-end damage.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident after review of the initial report and keywords in the incident description.
A claims agent was assigned to handle the case to coordinate subsequent communications and inspections.
We acknowledged receipt of the claim and informed the insured about the next steps for processing their auto accident claim.
The insured was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the accident report filed with local authorities.
All requested documentation including photos, police report, and repair estimates were submitted by the insured.
The investigation team began reviewing the submitted documents and assessing the accident circumstances.
Investigation concluded confirming the insured was not at fault and the extent of vehicle damage was verified.
We proposed a settlement amount to cover the repair costs and temporary transportation expenses.
The insured responded positively to the settlement offer and expressed satisfaction with the claim handling process.
The claim was approved following agreement on the proposed settlement, authorizing payment to the insured.
Payment was issued to the insured for the agreed settlement amount covering all vehicle repairs and related costs.
The claim file was closed successfully after confirming all payments were processed and no further issues remained.
The claim documentation and records were archived in compliance with regulatory retention policies.
